channel.title: Client wont connect?
channel.description: I'm using a PI server. I went into client.java and changed my ip and port. 127.0.0.1:5555 Then I compiled with no errors. When I try to log in it says the server is down. I have my source running. Help?

item.title: Client wont connect?
item.dc:creator: @kicker862 kicker862
item.description:
@kicker862 wrote:

Isnt this all I have to do?

Read full topic

item.title: Client wont connect?
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

Then you didn’t add the exception to your fire wall for the port to allow connections.

Read full topic

item.title: Client wont connect?
item.dc:creator: @kicker862 kicker862
item.description:
@kicker862 wrote:

It lets me connect when I turn off the firewall.

Read full topic

item.title: Client wont connect?
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

A fast test is to shut off your firewall, if you connect then you need to add the exception, if you cannot still connect then your router may still be the problem.

Read full topic

item.title: Client wont connect?
item.dc:creator: @kicker862 kicker862
item.description:
@kicker862 wrote:

voetbal645:

are you sure your utorrent isn’t opened?

It isnt open.

[quote=“jmood128, post:11, topic:443014”][quote author=voetbal645 link=topic=545704.msg4000136#msg4000136 date=1337870622]
are you sure your utorrent isn’t opened?
[/quote]

If utorrent was open he would get a run time error. Check to make sure your desktop firewall is allowing connections by that port, it can also be a problem by your router if you have one and you’re trying to connect from a non local host address.

I have a few questions.

  1. Are you connecting from local or non local host?

  2. Is your client connecting from local or non local host?

  3. Did you check to make sure you port forwarded correctly?

  4. I have no more questions, but I felt like writing a number four…[/quote]

  5. Are you connecting from local or non local host?
    Local host. 192.168.1.80 for my desktop

  6. Is your client connecting from local or non local host?
    Local host. 127.0.0.1

  7. Did you check to make sure you port forwarded correctly?
    I dont think I port forwarded correctly since canyouseeme isnt saying its open. I dont understand why I would do it wrong though since I have successfully forwarded 43594 numerous times.
    What I did to port forward.
    1: Went to my routers config. Its a linksys.
    2: I went on the application and gaming tab.
    3: I made a new entry.
    Title: Rsps
    Port range start: 5555
    Port range end: 5555
    Protocol: TCP
    Forward to: 192.168.1.80 (My desktops IP)
    Enabled: Yes
    Saved settings. Still says my port is offline.

  8. I have no more questions, but I felt like writing a number four…
    I felt like answering a number four…

Forgot the firewall. I originally set up my firewall on Win Vista but now I’m on win7 so I was thinking they were already opened on my firewall. I’ll post those results.

Read full topic

item.title: Client wont connect?
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

voetbal645:

are you sure your utorrent isn’t opened?

If utorrent was open he would get a run time error. Check to make sure your desktop firewall is allowing connections by that port, it can also be a problem by your router if you have one and you’re trying to connect from a non local host address.

I have a few questions.

  1. Are you connecting from local or non local host?

  2. Is your client connecting from local or non local host?

  3. Did you check to make sure you port forwarded correctly?

  4. I have no more questions, but I felt like writing a number four…

Read full topic
